intro: Oreoselinum peucedanoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white flowers appear in clustered umbels during late spring to early summer. Oreoselinum peucedanoides is often found in woodland edges and moist meadows, where it thrives in partial shade.
